bibl.title: James A. Balch v. J.W. Waughop. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: COMPLAINT. AND COMMITMENT
TERRITORY OF WASHINGTON, County of Yakima In the matter of . . . . . an insane person

David Guilland, being duly sworn, on oath, says there is in said county an insane (idiotic) person, whose name is James A. Balch, who, by reason of insanity ( ), is unsafe to be at large (or is suffering under mental derangement) ; and affiant therefore asks that said person be arrested and taken before a Judge of Probate within said county for examination.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 20 day of June A.D. 1883
J.A. Navarre, Probate Judge.
D. Guilland
COMMITMENT.

James A. Balch the person named in the foregoing affidavit, being this day brought before me, Judge of the Probate Court Yakima county, for examination on a charge of insanity, and no jury being demanded either by him or by anyone in his behalf, and having heard the testimony of David Guilland witness who has in Yakima City been acquinted with the accused during the time of the alleged insanity; and Drs. W.F. Morrison and J.O. Clark who respectfully and legally qualified physicians, after hearing the testimony of witnesses, after a personal examination of the accused, having made the certificate by law required; and being myself satisfied that the said James A. Balch is insane (or idiotic) and being further satisfied of the truth of all the matters set forth in the certificate of said Physicians, I do hereby order the said James A. Balch to be confined in the Hospital for the Insane at Fort Steilacoom, and the Sheriff of this county is charged with the execution of this order.
The seal of the said Witness my hand and seal this 20 day of June 1883 James A. Navarre Probate Judge of Yakima County W.T.
(Seal) Yakima County W.T. Probate Court

After inquiry as by law required, I find the said James A. Balch, is unable to pay his expenses in the hospital at the sum of forty five 00/100 Dollars for over two months, he has relatives who - (see code sec. 1632, 1655, 2697-8) have some property in Klickilat County and he has a wife Mrs. Hattie M. Balch in Syle Klickilat Co. W.T. Whereas my hand and seal this 20 day of June seal
Copy of order of COMMITMENT of James A Balch of Yakima County to the HOSPITAL + FOR + THE + INSANE, AT FORT STEILACOOM, Washington Territory
Date of admission June 8 1883

p.del: I hereby certify that the within are true and correct copies of the original Complaint, Physicians Certificate and Commitment in the matter of . . . . . an insane (or idiotic) person, this day committed by me to the Hospital for the Insane of Washington Territory.

body.p: Territory of Washington County of Yakima } ss
IN THE PROBATE COURT OF YAKIMA CO., W.T.
In the matter of the insanity of Warrant of commitment James A. Balch. to insane Hospital & c. Insane
To the Sheriff of Yakima County, Washington Territory, GREETING:

Whereas, James A. Balch has this day been brought before J.A. Navarre, Judge of the Probate Court in and for said Yakima, Co., W.T. charged with being insane upon the application and complaint of David Guilland, and it appearing to the satisfaction of the said Judge that the said James A. Balch is insane and unsafe to be at large. Therefore, in the name of the United States, you are commanded forthwith to carry the said James A. Balch safely to the Hospital for the insane in Washington Territory, near Steillacoom, and place him in charge of the proper officers of said hospital and make return of this writ with your donings thereon.
(Seal of Probate Court of Yakima Co., W.T.)
WITNESS the Hon. J.A. Navarre, Judge of the Probate Court of Yakima County W.T. and the Seal of the said Court affixed this 2nd day of June, 1883
J.A. Navarre, Judge of the Ex-Officio Clerk Probate Court.
In RE James A. Balch, Insane.
Warrant of Commitment to Insane hospital.
